guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for lansoprazole and CYP2C19

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299062

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for lansoprazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on lansoprazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299061

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of lansoprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the incidence of side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299060

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of lansoprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the incidence of side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299063

text.html: For Helicobacter pylori ERADICATION THERAPY: 1. Use a 4-fold higher dose. 2. Advise the patient to contact their doctor if symptoms of dyspepsia persist. OTHER INDICATIONS: 1. Be alert to reduced effectiveness. 2. If necessary, use a 4-fold higher dose. 3. Advise the patient to report persisting symptoms of dyspepsia.

implications: The genetic variation may reduce lansoprazole plasma concentrations and therefore lansoprazole effectiveness.

citations.title: Pharmacogenetics: from bench to byte--an update of guidelines.
authors: Rongen G A P J M
